{{Day}} The end of this day marks the halfway point of a [[leap year]]. It also falls on the same day of the week as [[New Year's Day]] in a leap year.

==Events==
*  [[69]] &ndash; [[Tiberius Julius Alexander]] orders his [[Roman legion]]s in [[Alexandria]] to swear [[allegiance]] to [[Vespasian]] as [[Roman Emperor|Emperor]].
* [[552]] &ndash; [[Battle of Taginae]]: [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] forces under [[Narses]] defeat the [[Ostrogoths]] in Italy. During the fightings king [[Totila]] is mortally wounded.
*[[1097]] &ndash; [[Battle of Dorylaeum (1097)|Battle of Dorylaeum]]: [[Crusade]]rs led by prince [[Bohemond I of Antioch|Bohemond of Taranto]] defeat a [[Seljuk Turks|Seljuk]] army led by sultan [[Kilij Arslan I]].
*[[1431]] &ndash; The [[Battle of La Higueruela]] takes place in [[Granada]], leading to a modest advance of [[Kingdom of Castile|Castilian]] during the [[Reconquista]].
*[[1523]] &ndash; [[Johann Esch and Heinrich Voes]] become the first [[Lutheran]] martyrs, burned at the stake by [[Roman Catholic]] authorities in [[Brussels]].
*[[1569]] &ndash; [[Union of Lublin]]: the Kingdom of Poland and the [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]] confirm a [[real union]]; the united country is called the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]] or the Republic of Both Nations.
*[[1653]] &ndash; First meeting of the [[Westminster Assembly of Divines]]
*[[1690]] &ndash; [[Glorious Revolution]]: [[Battle of the Boyne]] (as reckoned under the [[Julian calendar]]).
*[[1766]] &ndash; [[Jean-François de la Barre|Jean-François Lefebvre de la Barre]] was a young French nobleman, famous for having been [[torture|tortured]] and [[Decapitation|beheaded]] before his body was burnt on a [[pyre]] along with a copy of [[Voltaire|Voltaire's]] "[[Philosophical Dictionary]]" nailed to his torso for the crime of not saluting a [[Roman Catholic]] religious procession in [[Abbeville]], [[France]].
*[[1770]] &ndash; [[Lexell's Comet]] passed closer to the [[Earth]] than any other comet in recorded history, approaching to a distance of 0.0146 a.u.
*[[1782]] &ndash; American [[privateer]]s attack [[Lunenburg, Nova Scotia (town)|Lunenburg, Nova Scotia]] see [[Raid on Lunenburg (1782)]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; A system of the [[civil registration]] of births, marriages and deaths is established in England and Wales.
*[[1855]] &ndash; Signing of the [[Quinault Treaty]]: the [[Quinault people|Quinault]] and the [[Quileute people|Quileute]] cede their land to the United States.
*[[1858]] &ndash; Joint reading of [[Charles Darwin]] and [[Alfred Russel Wallace]]'s papers on [[evolution]] to the [[Linnean Society]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; The [[Russian State Library]] is founded.
*  1862   &ndash; [[Princess Alice of the United Kingdom]], second daughter of Queen Victoria, marries Prince Louis of Hesse, the future [[Louis IV, Grand Duke of Hesse]].
*  1862   &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: the [[Battle of Malvern Hill]] takes place. It is the final battle in the [[Seven Days Campaign]], part of [[George B. McClellan]]'s [[Peninsula Campaign]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[Keti Koti]] (Emancipation Day) in [[Suriname]], marking the abolition of [[slavery]] by the Netherlands.
*  1863   &ndash; American Civil War: the [[Battle of Gettysburg]] begins.
*[[1867]] &ndash; The [[Constitution Act, 1867|British North America Act of 1867]] takes effect as the [[Constitution of Canada]], creating the [[Canadian Confederation]] and the [[Federation|federal]] [[dominion]] of Canada; Sir [[John A. Macdonald]] is sworn in as the first [[Prime Minister]] of Canada.
*[[1870]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of Justice]] formally comes into existence.
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Prince Edward Island]] joins the [[Canadian Confederation]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; The [[Sholes and Glidden typewriter]], the first commercially successful [[typewriter]], goes on sale.
*[[1878]] &ndash; Canada joins the [[Universal Postal Union]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Charles Taze Russell]] publishes the first edition of the religious magazine ''[[The Watchtower]]''.
*[[1881]] &ndash; The world's first international [[telephone call]] is made between [[St. Stephen, New Brunswick]], Canada, and [[Calais, Maine]], United States.
*  1881   &ndash; General Order 70, the culmination of the [[Cardwell Reforms|Cardwell]] and [[Childers Reforms|Childers]] reforms of the [[British Army]], comes into effect.
*[[1885]] &ndash; The United States terminates [[reciprocity (Canadian politics)|reciprocity]] and [[fishery]] agreement with Canada.
*[[1890]] &ndash; Canada and [[Bermuda]] are linked by [[telegraphy|telegraph]] cable.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Spanish–American War]]: the [[Battle of San Juan Hill]] is fought in [[Santiago de Cuba]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; Start of [[1903 Tour de France|first Tour de France]] [[Bicycle racing|bicycle race]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[SOS]] is adopted as the international [[distress signal]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; Germany despatched the gunship ''[[SMS Panther|Panther]]'' to Morocco, sparking the [[Agadir Crisis]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; ''[[Leutnant]]'' [[Kurt Wintgens]] of the then-named German [[Luftstreitkräfte|''Fliegertruppe'']] air service achieves the first known aerial victory with a [[Synchronization gear|synchronized machine-gun]] armed fighter plane, the [[Fokker E.I|Fokker M.5K/MG]] ''Eindecker''.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[First day on the Somme]] &ndash; On the first day of the [[Battle of the Somme]] 19,000 soldiers of the [[British Army]] are killed and 40,000 wounded.
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[Communist Party of China]] is founded.
*[[1922]] &ndash; The [[Great Railroad Strike of 1922]] begins in the United States.
*[[1923]] &ndash; The [[Canadian Parliament]] suspends all [[History of Chinese immigration to Canada|Chinese immigration]].
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[United Airlines]] begins service (as Boeing Air Transport).
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Regina, Saskatchewan]] police and [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] ambush strikers participating in [[On-to-Ottawa Trek]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[first Battle of El Alamein]].
*  1942   &ndash; The [[Australian Federal Government]] becomes the sole collector of [[income tax in Australia]] as the State Income Tax is abolished.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Tokyo City]] merges with [[Tokyo Prefecture]] and is dissolved. Since then, no city in Japan has had the name "Tokyo" (present-day Tokyo is not officially a city).
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[Philippine Air Force]] is established.
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Muhammad Ali Jinnah]] (Quaid-i-Azam) inaugurates [[Pakistan]]'s [[central bank]], the [[State Bank of Pakistan]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; The merger of two princely states of India, [[Cochin]] and [[Travancore]], into the state of [[Thiru-Kochi]] (later re-organized as [[Kerala]]) in the Indian Union ends more than 1,000 years of princely rule by the [[Cochin Royal Family]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[International Geophysical Year]] begins.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]] links [[television]] broadcasting across Canada via [[microwave]].
*  1958   &ndash; Flooding of Canada's [[St. Lawrence Seaway]] begins.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Party of the African Federation]] holds its constitutive conference.
*  1959   &ndash; Specific values for the international [[yard]], [[avoirdupois pound]] and derived units (e.g. inch, mile and [[ounce]]) are adopted after agreement between the U.S.A., the United Kingdom and other [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] countries.
*[[1960]] &ndash; Independence of [[Somalia]].
*  1960   &ndash; [[Ghana]] becomes a [[Republic]] and [[Kwame Nkrumah]] becomes its first [[President of Ghana|President]] as Queen [[Elizabeth II]] ceases to be its [[Head of state]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; Independence of [[Rwanda]].
*  1962   &ndash; Independence of [[Burundi]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[ZIP code]]s are introduced for [[United States Postal Service|United States mail]].
*  1963   &ndash; The British Government admits that former [[diplomat]] [[Kim Philby]] had worked as a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Espionage|agent]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; The first [[color television]] transmission in Canada takes place from Toronto.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[European Community]] is formally created out of a merger with the [[Common Market]], the [[European Coal and Steel Community]], and the [[Euratom|European Atomic Energy Commission]].
*  1967   &ndash; Canada celebrates the [[Canadian Centennial|100th anniversary]] of the British North America Act, 1867, which officially made Canada its own federal dominion.
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA's]] [[Phoenix Program]] is officially established.
*  1968   &ndash; The [[Nuclear non-proliferation treaty]] is signed in Washington, D.C., London and Moscow by sixty-two countries.
*  1968   &ndash; Formal separation of the [[United Auto Workers]] from the [[AFL–CIO]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; President General [[Yahya Khan]] abolishes One-Unit of [[West Pakistan]] restoring the provinces.
*[[1972]] &ndash; The first [[Gay Pride]] march in [[Pride London|England]] takes place.
*[[1976]] &ndash; Portugal grants autonomy to [[Madeira]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[Northern Territory]] in Australia is granted Self-Government.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Sony]] introduces the [[Walkman]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; "[[O Canada]]" officially becomes the [[national anthem]] of Canada.
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[Wonderland murders]] occurred in the early morning hours, allegedly masterminded by businessman and drug dealer [[Eddie Nash]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; A [[North Korea]]n [[Ilyushin Il-62]]M jet en route to [[Conakry]] [[Airport]] in [[Guinea]] crashes into the [[Fouta Djallon]] [[mountain]]s in [[Guinea-Bissau]], killing all 23 people on board.
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[PG-13]] rating is introduced by the [[Motion Picture Association of America|MPAA]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The American radio station [[WFAN]] in [[New York City|New York, New York]] is launched as the world's first [[sports radio|all-sports radio]] station.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[German reunification]]: [[East Germany]] accepts the [[Deutsche Mark]] as its currency, thus uniting the economies of East and West Germany.
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Warsaw Pact]] is officially dissolved at a meeting in [[Prague]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; China resumes sovereignty over the city-state of Hong Kong, ending 156 years of British [[colonialism|colonial]] rule.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[Scottish Parliament]] is officially opened by [[Elizabeth II]] on the day that legislative powers are officially transferred from the old [[Scottish Office]] in London to the new devolved [[Scottish Executive]] in [[Edinburgh]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; The [[International Criminal Court]] is established to prosecute individuals for [[genocide]], [[crimes against humanity]], [[war crimes]], and the [[crime of aggression]].
*  2002   &ndash; [[Bashkirian Airlines Flight 2937]] and a [[Deutsche Post|DHL]] (German cargo) [[Boeing 757]] [[Überlingen mid-air collision|collide in mid-air]] over [[Überlingen]], southern Germany, killing 71.
*[[2003]] &ndash; Over 500,000 people protested against efforts to pass [[Hong Kong Basic Law Article 23|anti-sedition legislation]] in Hong Kong.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Saturn]] [[orbit insertion]] of [[Cassini–Huygens]] begins at 01:12 [[UTC]] and ends at 02:48 UTC.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The first operation of [[Qinghai–Tibet Railway]] in China.
*[[2007]] &ndash; Smoking in England is [[Smoking ban in England|banned]] in all public indoor spaces.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[2008 riot in Mongolia|Rioting erupted in Mongolia]] in response to allegations of fraud surrounding the 2008 legislative elections.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Croatia]] becomes the [[Accession of Croatia to the European Union|28th member]] of the [[European Union]].
* 2013 &ndash; The [[United Nations]] mission [[United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali|MINUSMA]] begins its operative mandate in [[Mali]].
*  2013   &ndash; [[Neptune]]'s moon [[S/2004 N 1]] is discovered.
